intro: Gonolobus esmeraldasianus, commonly known as the Emeralds Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in vibrant shades of blue and purple. The plant typically grows as a vine, with heart-shaped leaves and a rapid growth habit. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
